intro: Scleranthus polycnemoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in disturbed soils, often found in fields and along roadsides. It is an annual herb that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
